      Nexustentialism
      5 Movies That Need To Be Made
      April 11, 2016 by Zoey Brandt

       

      via ibizavida.com

      Every year, it seems like the same movies are released over and over again under different names. You’ve got the classic love stories, the routine sitcom-y jokes, a stoner movie, some Oscar bait and another superhero sequel. So here are some movies that we would like to see on our Netflix queue to mix it up a little.

       

      1. Sunday Night Dinner

      via howstuffworks.com

      Category: Comedy

      Martha and Jake are bored newlyweds in the suburbs of Portland, Oregon. After reading the infamously raunchy Forty Shades of Red, Martha suggests spicing up their sex life by adding another couple into the mix. With the help of friend Chris, they inadvertently start a neighborhood orgy ring that they eventually expand into a business in an attempt to save their house.

       

      2. Shoot for the Crown

      via 3riversarchery.com

      Category: Sports

      After her father leaves the English countryside to fight in the Great War, Anne embarks on a journey of self-discovery through archery. Desperate to remain connected to her M.I.A father, she begins training. As time goes on, her efforts catch the attention of her school’s librarian, a former archery star who takes Anne under her wing and trains her for the 1920 Olympics. Things take a turn when Anne is recruited to join the mafia and is sent on a mission to kill the Queen.

       

      3. The Photographer

      via pinterest.com

      Category: Horror

      In the early ‘90s, Mark receives seven numbered rolls of film in the mail one day with no note and no return address. Curious, he gets them developed. The pictures are all of him. The dates on the photos start one week in the future. The last photo is of his corpse. As the events in the photos begin happening, Mark must find the photographer before it’s too late. (Spoiler: The photographer was him all along)

       

      4. When All Your Dreams Come True

      via puckermob.com

      Category: Sci-Fi

      In a dystopian alternate universe where all dreams come true, the dangerous balance between safety and the apocalypse lies in citizens’ diligent reporting of potentially catastrophic dreams to the police. People have evolved to not dream. Those who do are shunned from society. When Sara, a Dreamer living in the isolated countryside, neglects to report her dream of the world ending not once, but twice, she is sent on a very important mission back in time to find the creator of the device that makes all dreams come true. Her mission? Kill the creator. In a race against time, she enters another world … a world full of Dreamers.

       

      5. True Love’s Text

      via telegraph.co.uk

      Category: Romance

      It’s a classic story of boy meets girl. Lyla and Jim meet at a train station going home for Christmas break and are separated before numbers can be exchanged. In a burst of bravery, she posts on Yik Yak about the cute guy from the train station, and lo and behold, he responds. Their relationship unfolds over a series of sporadic texts, Facebook stalks and chance Tinder encounters in a love story for the modern age.

       

      Zoey Brandt is a second year English major who enjoys thinking up story ideas and not writing them down.
